description: Elmspa is a hidden gem in the heart of Church/Wellesley Village, offering an array of exclusive treatments for women and men. An offspring of the acclaimed Elmwood Spa, elmspa is easily accessible, situated just blocks away from Cabbagetown, Riverdale, Yorkville and Bloor Street in downtown Toronto.

reviews.title: Perfect Self Care Oasis
text: My friend and I went for an 80 minute aromatherapy massage last week and it was divine. I had Isaac, he was fantastic. He had intuitive, magic hands. I forget the name of the lady that my friend had, but she too was incredible!
We both left feeling relaxed and taken care of.
Ronite was a warm and friendly manager who took us from station to station and ensured that our visit was everything we needed it to be. She's a charming and bright addition to the place!
Thanks for everything and we can't wait to visit again.

reviews.title: such a relaxing day!
text: My mom, my mother-in-law and my daughter (for her 13th birthday!) and I spent a Saturday afternoon at the Elmspa. What a delight!! I have been to the ElmWOOD spa several times (also wonderful), but had never ventured over to this peaceful oasis. I had no idea! Since there were four of us and only one RMT and one aesthetician we essentially had the whole place to ourselves. Nicky at reception was so friendly and helpful, and we could not speak more highly of Kamelia (aesthetician), and Andre (RMT - best massage ever!!). There is no water therapy, but the steam room in the woman's washroom was more than enough to feel cleansed! Will definitely be going back. Oh, one thing... bring snacks if you will be there for a while. There is no food. Lovely tea though!

reviews.title: The Aethetician was very good
text: Its a great place to visit , very quaint spa. Staff are good .
Massage Therapist and Aesthetician , are good. Very happy to have been there.

reviews.title: Elmspa Facial
text: My experience at Elmspa was incredible! I highly recommend this small spa on Church St, which is the sister location to the Elmwood Spa on Elm St.  The staff were so warm, friendly and knowledgeable. The facilities were pristine! The decor is so calm, sophisticated but unpretentious. I enjoyed a 25 min infrared sauna before my Elmline Essential facial, which included a premium masque and eye treatment. Loved it and will absolutely be going back.

reviews.title: Peaceful, tranquil oasis in downtown Toronto
text: My 4-star rating for Elmspa is focused mainly on the beautiful venue and friendliness of the staff. A lovely little oasis in downtown Toronto, and the prices are more affordable than other spas! My friend and I visited on a Friday afternoon (my treat). Elmspa was easy to find. We had ring up to the third floor to be let into the building, and an elevator whisked us up to the spa. The receptionist was friendly and welcoming, offered us a choice of tea or cucumber water while we filled out our first-visit forms.

The women's change room was small (only one small bench) but clean and well-maintained. We were provided with robes, towels and slippers. We were invited to use the steam room, which we did - lovely! We also both loved the infared sauna, which had been preheated for us.

After the sauna, we waited out the Garden space -- SO nice! Elmspa has made wonderful use of such a small space. I've been to many spas during travel and this space really did a wonderful job of capturing the peaceful and calming atmosphere of the high end bigger spas.

re: services. I have read many glowing reviews of the Elmspa services on TripAdvisor, so I am going to assume that my experience was unique. My friend was also very happy with services, had no complaints. My massage, however, was not what I had hoped. I suspect that the massage therapist was distracted or had something else on his mind during my session? It's the only reason I can think of, given the rave reviews about his massages on TripAdvisor. He didn't seem to remember what I had asked him to focus on during the massage, seemed to be in a hurry at the end, wanting to wrap things up.

Again, however, I've seen others praise his massage services here on TripAdvisor, so I suspect my session was an exception. And my friend was very happy with her massage, which was given by the same person.

I also had my first facial ever! It will also be my last facial...but that's personal preference, not the fault of the woman giving the facial. I did learn a lot about facials, especially what I should be doing that I'm not. :-) My friend enjoyed hers.

After I paid up and my friend and I were putting our coats on, a homeless man arrived in the elevator - he was naked beneath his long coat (we could tell because his coat was open). Apparently he had buzzed up and lied about having an appointment. The receptionist spoke to him with courtesy but firmness, asking him if he would please leave. When he didn't, she said she would have to call security, and that's when he finally left.

I was impressed by the receptionist's professionalism in dealing with the situation, but also the courtesy with which she spoke to the homeless man. Apparently (this was confirmed by people I talked with in the ground floor lobby) the building has had problems with the homeless finding ways into the building, some of whom have stolen items from some floors. A sad situation.
Given the rave reviews on TripAdvisor about Elmspa, I would like to come back sometime.

reviews.title: Beautiful oasis in the heart of the city
text: This is a small tranquil spa; clean, well thought out with friendly caring staff. I contacted them very last minute and wasn't able to book a massage but I got a pedicure and some time in the infrared sauna. The pedicure was fine and I wish you were able to book a proper block of time in the infrared saunas as they are a very good treatment in themselves. It would also be better if they were turned on and fully warmed up before use to maximise the benefits and value for the client.

reviews.title: Exceeding Expectations
text: I LOVE Elmspa. The massage therapists are knowledgeable, incredible, affordable and never disappoint. There is an infrared spa which is really unique and such a great value for your money, since it is included! The staff are always very kind and caring, and have positive vibes. Even the herbal tea with brown sugar tastes better. I could not say nicer things about this place!

reviews.title: YESSS! AMEN!
text: I finally found my spot after going to different spas, this is the one. It might be small compared to the others, but it is beautiful. The Garden space outside is just heavenly and I can't imagine how gorgeous it will be during Summer. As soon as you walk in, there is a nice welcoming vibes with lovely scent. Shemane took time to show me around and gave me many suggestions of what I could for future visits; she has great customer service. My message therapist during that day, Mohsea, was educated and he knew how to work around the tight muscles. It was just exactly what I needed after a stressful year. Thank you AND you will definitely see more of me with friends and families!

reviews.title: Tranquil, peaceful spa with excellent services
text: If you want an outing with friends, chatter and laughs, this is not the place to come. If you want food and a pool and a whirlpool and a hot tub, this is not the place. But, if you want a peaceful, quiet, personal time, if you want a tranquil environment for excellent spa services, this is a wonderful choice. It is clean, the service is impeccable. I had a scrub and a massage and it was wonderful. I will go back.

reviews.title: Best Massage of My Life
text: I was hesitant to be massaged by a man, but as they were the only person available, I booked with Andre. Best massage of my life!! He knew every muscle, know and was so patient and diligent. Will definitely be back!

reviews.title: Nice hidden gem
text: Not sure I want to give a review because this place is a quiet hidden gem in downtown Toronto.
Not a huge spa, but great service and massages. The perfect size.

reviews.title: quiet retreat
text: Fabulous therapists.  Small and private.  No jacuzzi but lovely steam in locker room.
I love this small spa.

reviews.title: A quiet Oasis in the city
text: This place is a hidden gem!

A smaller more relaxing version of their larger spa downtown, the Elmspa on Church street is a great way to escape.   I have only been for massages and not used any other of their services however it all looks top notch.

I've been getting massages for years now and finding a good masseuse is like finding a good mechanic, it's difficult.   Insist and ask for Andrew as he is one of the best mechanics you will find for your body.    He has a great calming energy about him and he can zero in on your problem areas. He also offers some great tips for those of us chained to a desk at work.
The steam room is clean and a great way to lull yourself back to reality after a heavenly massage.

reviews.title: Why Haven't I Been Here Before!!
text: This was my first time at ElmSpa and so glad I have now gone there!  I was able to book an 80min massage same-day (amazing!).  When I arrived there wasn't anyone at reception but a great guest service rep came out pretty quickly and signed me in.  My massage was soooo great (Andrew - my masseuse - I highly recommend and he gave me tips after my massage on best way to sit at work to prevent unnecessary stress on my shoulders).  Change room/shower was lovely.  Great way to start my long weekend!  Definitely going back!

reviews.title: Facial with Kamila
text: She might just give the best facial I have ever had. The spa is cozy and clean and good for a "me" day excursion.

reviews.title: Amazing service!
text: The service was amazing, and my massage therapist was so great! Everyone was kind, and welcoming, and very professional. I had never been to this location, and I will definitely be visiting again.

reviews.title: A quiet oasis
text: Elmspa is a quiet oasis and it is my go-to spa for RMT massages.

I like the fact that it is almost always quiet there, and the garden-like waiting area is great! There are always plenty of magazines there to keep you entertained while waiting for the masseuse, and it is a great that they provide hot tea, fruits and fruit infused water.

There is a small steamroom in the changerooms. If you want to use it, it would be advisable to go there a bit early since it would take at least 10 minutes for the steam to heat up the room (it is normally off) - hardly an issue if you know what to expect.

Over the years, there have been some changes to the masseuses working here. Currently it is Peter who is mainly there and he does a great job with massages. His main technique is swedish but he also does some stretching techniques to relax various muscles groups, and not the hard brute-force types that some people might be used to.
As for prices, I think they are pretty competitive. If you buy 4 session they will throw in a 5th one for free, which is great!
Overall, I would recommend Elmspa if you are looking for a quiet place for a spa day.

reviews.title: A relaxing Spa experience
text: I had a delightful manicure, pedicure and facial at the Elmspa. My aesthetician was excellent and listened to my preferences and honoured them. She was very attentive and ensured I was comfortable with all treatments.The spa was quiet and relaxed, and I almost fell asleep. A definite find - I'll be back!

reviews.title: Elmspa
text: Always an excellent time. Peter is an amazing RMT and the relaxation areas and steam rooms are a great size.

reviews.title: Relaxing Retreat in the Concrete Jungle
text: It was my first time at Elmspa and what a great experience! I usually ask for a female RMT, but I was reassured by the Receptionist, when making the reservation over the phone, that Peter was a great RMT. She was definitely right! I usually have to ask the RMT to use the lightest touch possible, but with Peter I didn't have to (it was like he just knew!). I had an 80-minute Pregnancy massage, which was just absolutely wonderful! It was so wonderful that I fell asleep and may have snored, which Peter said was a compliment (thank you for not making me feel like a loud, snoring beached whale!).
After the massage, I took advantage of the Moroccanoil products that were available in the shower - it was a nice touch (who doesn't like Moroccanoil products?) and a nice way to end the massage!
Thank you Elmspa for a relaxing few hours away from the hustle and bustle!

reviews.title: quiet retreat
text: need a really good massage in a very quiet place.  this is it.
no extras but the  therapists are all certified and really pleasant.

reviews.title: A Calming Space
text: First of all , I have always had great customer service. I book through email and get immediate confirmations and reminders.
The space itself is small, elegant and quiet.
My masseuse is one of the best I have ever had and I've had a lot of massages in my day.
Doesn't have pool or extensive water therapies, but make sup for it in other ways.
This is a spa for adults.

reviews.title: Not quite a gem.
text: I like the location and the staff are very good. I had a wonderful Swedish massage and the aesthetician, Camila, is the best.
The problem that I have is with the management.

I called several times to book appointments and always have to leave a message and play phone tag. I email, and NEVER get a reply. I think that they really need to up their customer service and social media game. FB page. Nothing since 2013? I am not a millennial and I know that this is bad. Please make an effort.

reviews.title: quiet escape
text: Fantastic experience for a day off to pamper yourself. This is a quiet, zen, clean, green space, boutique spa. It is petite but has everything you need (amenities, toiletries, facilities) and high quality service, as described by the other reviewers.

reviews.title: I
text: Had a welcoming experience at the Elm Spa. The reception by Victoria and massage by Andre were unsurpassed. I am taking my daughters there for a family treat. The spa offers peace and healthful attention right down to the apples and tea. Highly recommend- but sshhh, don’t tell too many people, it’s such a find!

reviews.title: Spa in the city
text: My partner and I have gone to Elmspa several times now for a spa day and it was fabulous every single time.  We love that the location feels like an oasis in the city and it feels like we have the entire place toourselves.  The staff is always very friendly and the treatments we get are well worth it.   We will definitely continue going back here!

reviews.title: Facial
text: Excellent spa with a wonderful peaceful ambience. Much better than anticipated. Staff were welcoming and lovely and the facial was fantastic. Will go back.

reviews.title: Great deep tissue massage
text: Awesome staff  & service! Massage was great! Ambience excellent. Steam room was heavenly & so relaxing tbh

reviews.title: Massage
text: Great, quiet and clean.
50 minute massage is always good here.
Always go to Church street because it’s never crowded.

reviews.title: Elmspa Escape - a pre-Mother's Day treat!
text: It was absolutely amazing!  The spa is intimate, the staff are friendly and very good at their jobs and the atmosphere is lovely.  One of my favourite spas I have ever been to!!

reviews.title: Welcome respite
text: This is an elegant, serene space. Staff are welcoming and attentive. Peter is a fabuloos masseur.
Ive been going for years and it never disappoints.

reviews.title: Boutique Spa Experience
text: Amazing and relaxing environment that truly soothes the soul!
If you are not interested in the factory-type spa, this is the place for you!

reviews.title: Amazing  Service
text: I enjoyed the Elm-spa as it was quiet and  very relaxing  atmosphere. The staff were very warm and welcoming.   The  facial  was very good and I do like  the products the Elm Spa uses . Will definitely return to book more services.

reviews.title: Amazing Service!
text: Elmspa is a fantastic spa! It was quiet and cosy, and would definitely go again. My friends and I planned a spa day last minute and the spa was welcoming and opened early to accommodate us. Great customer service.
